title: Intelligent Medical Prescription Reader
description: Proof of Concept (POC) web app built with Next.js, demonstrating OCR and NLP to read, interpret, and standardize information from medical prescriptions in image format. Automates reading and understanding prescriptions using AI, making the process faster, safer, and less prone to human error. Uses Tesseract.js for OCR and compromise for NLP to extract and normalize drug names, dosages, and quantities, even with writing variations or OCR errors. Not intended for production or real medical use.
overview: Uploads a prescription image, extracts text with Tesseract.js, processes and normalizes with compromise NLP, and returns structured drug info. Uses a local, simplified database for simulation.
howItWorks: User uploads a photo of a medical prescription.
Tesseract.js extracts text from the image.
Compromise NLP normalizes and processes the text, identifying drug name, dosage, and quantity.
System standardizes drug names and returns structured data.
Uses a local, limited database for demonstration only.
limitations: Not for real or production use.
projectStructure: src/app/page.tsx — Main page and upload interface.

title: Braian Mendes Portfolio
description: Personal portfolio built with Next.js, React, and Tailwind CSS. Showcases my projects, certifications, recommended books, and blog posts. Features advanced filtering, responsive and accessible UI, and a modern developer experience.
overview: A modern, performant, and accessible portfolio to present my work, learning journey, and thoughts on software engineering. Includes sections for projects, certifications, books, blog, and about.
howItWorks: Visitors can browse and filter projects, certifications, and books.
Each section provides detailed information and links.

Responsive and theme-aware UI for all devices.

Continuously evolving with new features and content.
